title: Volume Control
content:
## What is Volume Control?

If your projector supports network-based audio control, you can adjust volume and mute audio directly from the application.

**Availability:**
- Must be enabled in **Settings > UI Buttons**
- Only works with projectors that support PJLink audio commands
- Not all projector models support this feature

## Adjusting Volume

**Steps:**
1. Locate the **Volume** slider in the control section
2. Drag the slider left (quieter) or right (louder)
3. The projector volume adjusts in real-time
4. Current volume percentage shown below slider

**Volume Range:**
- 0% - Completely silent (same as mute)
- 50% - Medium volume
- 100% - Maximum volume

## Muting Audio

**Quick mute:**
1. Click the **Mute** checkbox (or speaker-X icon)
2. Audio mutes immediately
3. Volume slider remains at previous position
4. Uncheck to restore audio at previous volume

**Mute vs. Volume 0:**
- **Mute** - Temporary silence, one-click restore
- **Volume 0** - Silent, must drag slider back up

## Compatibility

**Supported projectors:**
- Most modern network-enabled projectors
- PJLink Class 2 projectors
- Manufacturer-specific models with audio pass-through

**Unsupported:**
- Older PJLink Class 1 projectors
- Projectors without built-in speakers
- Projectors with audio-only via analog cables

**If volume control is disabled (grayed out):**
- Your projector does not support network audio control
- Use the projector's remote control for volume
- Check projector manual for audio capabilities

## Troubleshooting

**Volume commands fail:**
- Projector may not support audio via network
- Check if physical buttons on projector work
- Some projectors require audio to be enabled in settings menu

> **Note:** Not all projector models support volume control via network. If the slider is disabled (grayed out), your projector does not support this feature.
